channel.title: MBallSectionsDR
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from MBallSectionsDR, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Tim Walz says he was joking when he mocked Tesla's falling stock: 'These people have no sense of humor'
item.description: Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz said he was making a joke when he made a comment last week mocking Tesla and its CEO Elon Musk for the company's stock falling...

item.title: Why the Trump DOJ Must Be Forthright in Its Deportation Court Clash
item.description: The department cannot afford to lose credibility, with so much on the line.

item.title: The American Academy of Pediatrics Is Still Compromised by DEI
item.description: The result is ‘inclusion’ efforts that leave everyone feeling dissatisfied and aggrieved.

item.title: Musk threatens to sue after Democrat ex-Rep Jamaal Bowman calls him a 'Nazi' and 'thief' during TV appearance
item.description: Elon Musk warned that he's "had enough" and a lawsuit is "inbound' after ousted Rep. Jamaal Bowman, D-N.Y., called him a "Nazi" and a "thief" on CNN.

item.title: Trump suggests US could join British Commonwealth if offered by King Charles
item.description: President Trump said Friday that associate membership in the British Commonwealth "sounds good" to him in response to a report King Charles III would ...

item.title: Corals, Opals, Marble, and Glass
item.description: Materials for all seasons at the world’s grandest art fair, plus Cleopatra and a killer ship model.

item.title: Musk threatens lawsuit against former lawmaker for calling him a Nazi
item.description: White House efficiency czar Elon Musk threatened to sue former Squad member Jamaal Bowman after the ex-congressman called him a Nazi.

item.title: House Democrats demand Pentagon, FAA contain air traffic around Reagan National

item.title: Trump handles debate after booting suspected Venezuelan gang members
item.description: Confusion surfaced over whether President Trump signed a proclamation that invoked a centuries-old law to deport suspected Venezuelan gang members.

item.title: Blue city mayor ripped by local leaders for prioritizing politics over safety: 'Undermining public trust'

item.title: Kitty Dukakis, wife of former Massachusetts governor and presidential hopeful Michael Dukakis, dead at 88
item.description: Kitty Dukakis, the wife of former Massachusetts Gov. Michael Dukakis, who lost his presidential run to George H.W. Bush, has died. She was 88.

item.title: Bill Burr’s The View Appearance Betrays His ‘Screw You’ Brand
item.description: Joking with leftists about their favorite political bogeymen, Burr betrays the salt-of-the-earth persona and audience he once crafted.

item.title: The Unloved Iranian Revolution
item.description: The Islamic Republic of Iran is at an impasse. Its leaders cannot change; the public already has.

item.title: The Left Says It Doesn’t Happen, But Noncitizens Voted In Iowa’s Election
item.description: Until state and federal governments cooperatively close all the avenues for illegal voting, they will be exploited for election fraud.

item.title: Gov. Mark Gordon Makes Excuses As Wyoming Enacts Voter Proof Of Citizenship Law Without Him
item.description: Wyoming enacted a law requiring proof of citizenship and residency to vote. Its Republican governor refused to sign.

item.title: Kill the Education Department — with Legislation
item.description: The United States won the space race and sent men to walk on the moon without a federal Department of Education.

item.title: University of Maine Flinches, Agrees To Protect Women’s Sports Following Trump Admin Funding Threat
